title.narrative: Nam Theun 2 Social and Environment Project

description.narrative: To generate revenues, through environmentally and socially sustainable development of NT2's hydropower potential, which will be used to finance priority poverty reduction and environmental management programs.

participating-org.narrative: Ministry of Energy and Mines, Government of Laos PDR

title.narrative: Quality of Life in Enclave Villages (villages located in the watershed protected area)

baseline.value: Average household income was estimated to be around 375 USD per household per year. Schools were lacking in most of the villages inthe NT2 Watershed and wherever there are schools the level of teaching and facilities were poor. Healthcare services were erratic.Malaria, respiratory diseases and gastro-intestinal diseases were common. Infant mortality rates were very high, drinking waterrarely boiled and general sanitation very poor.

target.value: Improved quality of life for the enclave villages, with higher incomes, better access to basic services and their activeinvolvement in conservation.

actual.value: Physical infrastructure has improved and communities have largely continued to derive benefit from the land resources. Discussionand observations in the enclave villages suggest it is likely the affected villages have at least maintained their pre-projectlevels of income and protein equivalent from alternative livelihood options. A socio-economic survey of the 13 enclave villages isunderway, to be completed in early 2018 and the Consortium of Technical Experts includes an NGO specializing in livelihoods inconservation environments.

Effectiveness of Monitoring by Independent Expert Panels

target.value: Dam Safety Review Panel and International Panel of Social and Environmental Experts demonstrate ability to ensure dam safety andaccomplishment of E&S objectives and CA commitments to income targets of resettlers, watershed preservation, etc.

title.narrative: Audit reports for eligible programs (financed with NT2 revenues) are published (annually)
Financial statements (of NT2 revenues) are published
Ministry of Finance reports on implementation of revenue management arrangements and holds annual consultation with NT2 partners
The Watershed Management Protection Authority is able to execute all designated managerial functions in a technically sound, transparent and professional manner.
Basic public and social services are provided and improved in all resettlement villages on the Nakai Plateau

baseline.value: Public and social services were scarce and low quality.

target.value: The resettled population benefit from improved, stable and affordable basic services.

actual.value: The resettled population continues to benefit from improved and affordable basic services, as emphasized by the independent Panelof Experts.

target.value: Conservation and management of the NT2 watershed results in no further degradation of habitats or declines in populations ofthreatened species.

actual.value: Forest cover in the NT2 watershed has largely been maintained; however, pressure on wildlife populations and high-value timberremains. A five-year plan has been approved by a new Board, chaired by the Minister of Agriculture and Forestry Furthermore, aConsortium of Technical Experts (COTE) has been engaged to strengthen the capacity of the WMPA through providing technicalassistance and expertise on watershed management. Plans are progressing on preparing the area as Lao’s first national park.

title.narrative: Water Quality Adequacy in Nam Theun reservoir and Xe Bang Fai

baseline.value: Water quality corresponds to natural, pre-project conditions

target.value: Water quality is adequate to ensure sufficiency and diversity of fish stock in reservoir, XBF and NT, and also pose no threat topublic health.

actual.value: Water quality is adequate to ensure sufficiency and diversity of fish stock in reservoir, XBF and NT, and also pose no threat topublic health.

title.narrative: Maintenance of pre-project levels of income and protein equivalent in affected villages in the Xe Bang Fai river and the Nam Theun river (Text, Custom)

baseline.value: The Downstream Socioeconomic Survey implemented by NTPC in 2009 provides baseline values for incomes and consumption of fish andmeat in affected villages prior to project impacts

target.value: Affected villages in XBF and NT maintain their pre-project levels of income and protein equivalent from alternate livelihoodoptions during the immediate years after COD.

actual.value: Assessment of income levels suggests most households have more than exceeded pre-project incomes, although some of the very poormay not have met that average. Sustainable livelihood plans have recently been prepared in 92 villages that are most affected(those downstream and along the rivers), In addition, individual household business plans have been prepared and approved. Proteinlevels are met.

title.narrative: Annual average export to Electricite du Laos is not less than 200 GWh
